creator: IvanR158
title: Arduino+Java (Multiplexor)
description: This project uses an Arduino and Java to create a multiplexor circuit with 5 LEDs.
steps: Connect a wire from the third node E to the negative rail of the breadboard.
Connect the 330 Ohm resistor from the third node C to the seventh.
Connect an LED with the cathode to the negative rail and the anode to the sixth node J.
Connect the second LED with the cathode to the ninth negative rail and the anode to J12.
Connect the third LED with the cathode to the 14th negative rail and the anode to J18.
Connect the fourth LED with the cathode to the 19th negative rail and the anode to J24.
Connect a wire from the 21st negative rail to J25, and the last LED from the 24th negative rail to J30.
Connect a wire from A7 to the GND of the Arduino.
Connect a wire from the node of the first LED to pin 7 of the Arduino.
Connect a wire from the node of the second LED to pin -6 of the Arduino.
Connect a wire from the node of the third LED to pin -5 of the Arduino.
Connect a wire from the node of the fourth LED to pin 4 of the Arduino.
Connect a wire from the node of the last LED to pin 3 of the Arduino.
The Arduino and Java code is still needed for the project to function.
Once both codes are finished and the connections are correct, the project will be complete.
